title: Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences
summary: The Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences, officially the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel[2][3][4] (Swedish: Sveriges riksbanks pris i ekonomisk vetenskap till Alfred Nobels minne), is an economics award administered by the Nobel Foundation. Although not one of the Nobel Prizes established by Alfred Nobel's will in 1895,[5] the winners of the Prize in Economic Sciences are chosen in a similar way, are announced along with the Nobel Prize recipients, and the prize is presented at the Nobel Prize Award Ceremony.[6] As a result, it is commonly referred to as the Nobel Prize in Economics.[7]
